abstract.p: Roundup of recent advertising account changes (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: * Zatso, San Francisco, which operates an Internet newscast site, to Grant, Scott & Hurley, San Francisco, to handle its first account. Billings were estimated at $17 million. * Casio Inc., Dover, N.J., part of the Casio Computer Co., to Towne Silverstein Rotter, New York, to handle the account for its G-Shock and Baby-G watch brands, which had been at Della Femina/Jeary & Partners, owned by top managers and the Omnicom Group. Billings were estimated at $10 million to $12 million. * TechPlanet, Menlo Park, Calif., a technology consulting company that serves small businesses, to DDB Chicago, part of the DDB Worldwide unit of the the Omnicom Group, to handle its first account. Billings were estimated at $10 million. * Command Audio, Redwood City, Calif., an information and entertainment service that delivers programming through a hand-held wireless receiver, to Young & Rubicam Advertising, San Francisco, to handle its first account. Billings were estimated at $10 million. * 24/7 Media, New York, a worldwide Internet media and technology company, to the Romann Group, New York, to handle its account, which had been at the Renegade Marketing Group, New York, an affiliate of Dentsu USA. Billings were estimated at $5 million. * Allendale Pharmaceuticals, Allendale, N.J., to Williams Whittle Associates, Alexandria, Va., to handle the reintroduction of the Today Sponge Contraceptive. Billings were estimated at $3 million.
